fields.description:
jquery	2.2.4	Found in https://[bitbucket.url]/s/8e4cf074d3410ea25b8aed94f7c727d6-CDN/2101862398/d728021/1937/154057b82430b23e11bfb75940567a2c/_/download/contextbatch/js/_super/batch.js?locale=en-US\\
Vulnerability info:\\
Medium	2432 3rd party CORS request may execute CVE-2015-9251	1234\\
Medium	CVE-2015-9251 11974 parseHTML() executes scripts in event handlers

Atlassian Bitbucket v5.14.1

jquery-migrate	1.2.1	Found in https://d301sr5gafysq2.cloudfront.net/cd69d845441f/dist/webpack/common.js\\
Vulnerability info:\\
Medium	11290 Selector interpreted as HTML	12\\
jquery	2.1.4	Found in https://d301sr5gafysq2.cloudfront.net/cd69d845441f/dist/webpack/common.js\\
Vulnerability info:\\
Medium	2432 3rd party CORS request may execute CVE-2015-9251	1234\\
Medium	CVE-2015-9251 11974 parseHTML() executes scripts in event handlers	123

Bitbucket cloud:\\
https://bitbucket.org/dashboard/issues

Although this endpoint has been deprecated for API v2 (https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/bitbucket/deprecation-notice-v1-apis/?_ga=2.181452386.417879656.1531244294-1231042520.1527887148), there are some integrations that use deploy-keys to integrate with Bitbucket team accounts, such as Codacy.

Since the API v2 deprecates the deploy-keys endpoint, there is currently no way to automate the integration with such applications with deploy-keys for team accounts.

It would be great if this endpoint could be implemented for team accounts as well.
fields.summary: Add the "deploy-keys" API endpoint back for team accounts

fields.description:
It'll be great if as a Pull request reviewer,  suggestions can be provided to the author on how the code can be changed.

Once the suggestions are approved, it can be created as a new commit with the suggester as the new author of the commit.
fields.summary: Allow users to apply suggestions to pull requests

fields.description:
There seems to have been an 'update' where the dashboard/portal just has icons and not descriptive titles like it used to.\\
This is a major inconvenience and a hindrance to the UX.\\
There doesn't seem to be a way of reverting the layout to the better view.
fields.summary: Unable to change dashboard view

fields.description: I wish you'd save the status of "I'm Reviewing" so that I don't to click that button each time I visit the PR page.
fields.summary: Remember "I'm Reviewing" Filter Status

fields.description:
Hey All,

Whenever I create new repo, by default all the user groups are added to the repo. I want to understand if this is the default nature of BitBucket or is it something am doing wrong while create one.
fields.summary: Unwanted User Groups Added by Default

fields.description:
# Build time- There is a limit on build time for each run and we can not run more than 20 mins by default,it does not allow max build time more than 120 mins.
# System/Env Variables- Can not pass system/env variables to the bitbucket pipelines
# Max  number of jobs limit- Bitbucket as of now has a limit of 5 jobs. We can not schedule more than 5 jobs .
# Post and pre build scripts- Bitbucket doesn't provide customisation to setup auto post and pre builds for a particular job.
# Integration with services- i.e slack, mail , jira , or may be test case management tools.
# No bitbucket API- Bitbucket does not provide APIs as well , to trigger the tests via an api.
fields.summary: Listing Bitbucket pipeline limitations , possible to address below issues?
Feature request: Add filter to view limited set of files during review

fields.description:
It will be best to either restore the repo widget (the behavior that it allows users to see their latest build status in the repository initial page) or include more details when the sidebar is minimized.

*Current Situation*:\\
When you go to a repository initial page, the right panel is not maximized by default.\\
You'll need to click the "expand" icon on the right first before you can see the latest Pipelines build status.

*Expected Result*:\\
Users should be able to see their build status on the repository initial page without clicking the "expand" button.

*Workaround*:\\
Click the "expand" icon to see latest Pipelines build status
fields.summary: Icon indicating Pipeline status when right-hand sidebar is collapsed
Cannot revert squashed PR from bitbucket

fields.description: If you open a merged pull request that was merged using "Fast forward" the diff shows totally different changes than what the pull request originally contained.
fields.summary: Fast forward merge messes up the Pull request

fields.description:
Its been a while and I wanted to update the branch with the work my partner has put in. Then when i try to pull a window appears to get me to sign in with my Atlassian account. Only it keeps reappearing sometimes even multiple windows. I've tried resetting my password multiple times, tried downloading sourcetree again and creating a new project and repository and reupload the files. But every time the window appears it will not let me sign in and instead multiple appears.

Regards ssschoubye
fields.summary: Sourcetree login error

fields.description:
When viewing commits list in Bitbucket UI, the commit author will be taken from the email configured on the raw commit and mapped to a Bitbucket User Account if the email matches.

However, if the email does not match, it will show a question mark as the avatar of the commit author as it's not able to map to another Bitbucket User Account.

!2011473418-Commit%20Author.PNG|thumbnail!

It would be nice if we can put the default avatar instead of the question mark. The use case for this is that for a user would want to use the a specific name in work and a specific name for other repositories within the same Bitbucket Account.

Username Alias or Email Alias does not work in this case because a user would not want it to show the account name. Instead it should show the name as configured in the raw commit without showing the question mark.
fields.summary: Show default avatar on commit author instead of question mark

fields.description:
In some large pull requests, the number of lines added or removed is inaccurate.\\
As an example, you can see that in the screenshot below, there are a ton of files which are shown in the Pull request as changed but have zero lines added and zero lines removed.

!2229727991-Screen%20Shot%202018-10-15%20at%2014.06.22.png|thumbnail!

When checking these changes locally, the changes (and the number of changes) do show up correctly, however. The pull request is also showing in some cases "file unchanged" even though it contains some changes.
fields.summary: Diff is not correctly showing number of changes on Large Pull requests

My BitBucket login is running into a problem. I am able to log into Atlassian just fine, and I have SourceTree downloaded. My Atlassian profile is up and I have access to it. I am attempting to clone a Repository, and when prompted to log into Atlassian through SourceTree, I get an error in my Repository site stating that my username and password are incorrect. When I tried to login using the correct information, the Atlassian window pulls out multiple windows for login and does not work (Looping through "Checking source"). When I tried to troubleshoot using a wrong password, I immediately get a message saying there was a username and password error.

fields.description:
In the git clone link dialog the link is prefixed with "git clone", which is annoying in certain cases.

Example:\\
!2432138225-flameshot-2018-10-15-105022.png|thumbnail!

In the following cases you *don't* want that "git clone" prefix:

* When updating the git remote (e.g. when moving from a competing git provider to bitbucket).
* When using JetBrains IDE's that expect the bare git link when creating new projects from VCS.
* When you have the habit of already typing "git clone" before pasting the repo URL in your terminal.

Can either the "git clone" be removed from the link or a setting be added where I can disable this prefix?
fields.summary: Don't include "git clone" in the copy link

fields.description:
Pipeline build fails with "System error" status *intermittently* with "Error occurred whilst downloading or extracting artifact".

fields.description:
Recently MacOS Mojave improved and expanded the dark mode and it was promoted heavily in media. Many apps followed, introducing dark mode option in their interfaces.

BitBucket interface should also offer a dark mode - the pure white backgrounds look jarring against the latest dark wallpapers and dark toolbars and dark Chrome's menu bars.

!3860899609-dark_mode.png|thumbnail!

Let's add a new feature which would let BitBucket customers switch to a dark UI.

It could be a simple _toggle switch_ somewhere in the sidebar, for example:

!2375479882-toggle.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Dark mode for the BitBucket UI

fields.description:
It would be convenient if you add "accordion" to changed files in PR and commits. Hiding/Showing changed file content by clicking on file. This allows code reviewers to quickly understand which files have already been checked.

Something like https://getbootstrap.com/docs/4.1/components/collapse/#accordion-example

fields.description: In our repos we use gitflow and have the default branch set up on master as you'd expect. What is slightly annoying is generally pull requests get raised to develop 90% of the time, but every time we create a PR the default target is master instead. It would be amazing if it was possible to configure the default target branch for pull requests in a similar way that you can set default reviewers etc.

fields.description:
It is currently a bit of a hassle to switch which Repository you are in. For example, to switch from one to another, a user must click on the bitbucket home page,, then the repositories button, and then the repository that they want to switch to. When viewing one of the pages for a Repository, Bitbucket should (ex: https://bitbucket.org/[group]/[repository]/[src, pull-requests, etc]/) allow the user to easily switch the repository they are in by turning the button in the top left of the screen (that shows the Repository's Icon and Name) into a quick select (dropdown/type-ahead) that displays all of the repositories that the logged in user has access to.

Selecting one of the other Repos would take that user to the same page that they are on of corresponding repository. So, for example, if the user is in Repo1's Pull Requests page and they switch to Repo2 using this new feature, they would be taken to the Pull Requests page of Repo2. For simplicity, if they were viewing a page that only exists on that repo, take them to  a base page (ex: They're viewing a PR and switch, just take them to the list of PRs for the other repo) or just the {{/src}} page. To maintain some of the functionality of the Repository button currently has, clicking on the icon could take the user back to the {{[repo]/src}} page.

Attached is a picture of the current button that would be turned into the Repo Selector.
fields.summary: Simplify Switching Between Repos

fields.description:
The Delete button for Pipeline cache deletion does not work.

!1116168102-Screenshot%202018-10-11%20at%2022.32.08.png|thumbnail!

When the button is clicked, it generates errors in browser debug console.

{code}
home:17 Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'width' of undefined
    at e._width (connect-host.js:2210)
    at e.sanitizeOptions (connect-host.js:2307)
    at new e (connect-host.js:4064)
    at Object.constructor.u._construct.u._construct (connect-host.js:1256)
    at t._handleRequest (connect-host.js:1280)
    at t.e._receiveMessage (connect-host.js:1041)
    at o (raven.js:377)
    at nrWrapper (home:17)
{code}

The issue tested and happens on macOS:

* Safari (12.0 (14606.1.36.1.9))
* Chrome (69.0.3497.100)
fields.summary: Pipeline Cache delete button does not work

fields.description:
# Create PR
 # Approve
 # Push update to code (make sure it resets approvals)
 # Approve again

Trigger set to fire on PR create, updates, unapproves, and approves

Expected behavior:
 4 triggered events, one for each step

current behavior:
 Only 3 triggered events, 4th step does not trigger webhook

 

*Expanding on the issue description:* 

When using the "Reset approvals when the source branch is modified" feature of branch permissions. As expected Bitbucket resets the approvals on a push, however  they are reset in a way that means it approving the PR again will not trigger the webhook for PR approval event.

*Workaround until the issue is fixed:* 

The user can trigger the webhooks by "unapproving" and then "approving" the PR again
fields.summary: Approval webhook doesn't trigger after pr update resets approvals

fields.description:
Recently, our builds have started failing with the message:
{code:java}
Error processing tar file(exit status 1): Container ID 165586 cannot be mapped to a host ID
{code}
I can't figure out which part is failing, though from browsing other issues it appears to be some issue with user remapping. However, the only existing issues I can find that sound similar are to do with multistage builds. The build is failing some time after the {{apt-get autoremove}} in the following:
{code:java}
# Copy requirements in
COPY ./requirements.txt /app/
COPY requirements/ /app/requirements/

WORKDIR /app
# Install dependencies and requirements

RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y pkg-config git build-essential python-dev \
&& pip install --upgrade pip \
&& pip install --upgrade setuptools \
&& pip install -r requirements/server.txt \
&& rm -rf requirements/dependencies \
&& apt-get remove -y build-essential git pkg-config \
&& apt-get autoremove -y \
&& rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

# Copy the rest of the app
COPY . /app/

# Custom system config
COPY server/ /
{code}
 
----
*(on) Additional Information*

Identifying the right owner of the file/folders being exchanged between Docker containers that result in the error "Container ID cannot be mapped to a host ID" during a pipeline run?
{panel}
(i) This is important in resolving related issues, as once the file(s)/folder(s) are identified. Their ownership can be changed to 'root' in order to avoid the resulting error.

Example error: _"Container ID 165569 cannot be mapped to a host ID_" we can make an initial conclusion that the container ID *165569* is unable to map with the host ID. It is important to get the right user ID on the host container from the child container ID *165569* pointing to. Steps below help to find the same:
----
Docker user namespace configurations are stored within the following two files '/etc/subuid' and '/etc/subgid', which looks as follows on Bitbucket Pipelines:
{code:java}
pipelines:100000:65536
{code}
For instance, with "*pipelines:100000:65536*" it means that user *pipelines* can use 65536 user ids starting at 100000. Now a user ID 165569 on a host container would refer to *165569 - (100000+65536) = 33*

After getting the host user ID, you can use the following command to find all the files that belong to it:
{code:java}
RUN find / -uid 33 -ls
{code}
Ideally, for a multi-stage build and DinD setup, the easiest trick to make everything working is by changing the ownership of the folder to *root* that is failing to get copied to the child container:
{code:java}
chown -R root:root file/folder{code}
{panel}
fields.summary: Docker builds started failing with "Container ID cannot be mapped to a host ID" error

fields.description:
bq. On 27th September 2018, we rolled out a change to enable user namespace remapping in our docker in docker daemon we provide to users as part of a steps execution to harden the security of pipelines.


https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/infrastructure-changes-in-bitbucket-pipelines-872135046.html

The first thing to mention is that we were not aware of this change, it just happened and broke our code pipelines for several projects.

We're using {{docker run [...]}} and mounting volumes because we want to maintain a consistent way to build our code. [Ideally the same way a developer builds the code in their laptop is the same way we build in CI.|https://medium.com/magnetcoop/using-docker-compose-in-bitbucket-pipelines-81ead8cf0153]

For that we're also using custom [caches for maven|https://medium.com/magnetcoop/caching-dependencies-in-bitbucket-pipelines-when-running-a-dockerized-build-44c66732597d] artifacts.

With the new changes related to user namespace remapping the custom cache setup broke. A container spawned from a {{docker run}} command in a step can write to the _host_ folder, but when you enable the custom cache definition it breaks due to permissions.

You can find the minimum failing test case in this repository:

* https://bitbucket.org/magnet-coop/pipeline-cache-debug

You'll find a successful build (just pulling the deps and printing the owner and content of the cached dependencies) on build number [14|https://bitbucket.org/magnet-coop/pipeline-cache-debug/addon/pipelines/home#%21/results/14]. Then we enabled the cache definition and build [16|https://bitbucket.org/magnet-coop/pipeline-cache-debug/addon/pipelines/home#%21/results/16] and failed.
fields.summary: Custom dependency cache and user namespace remapping

fields.summary: Weird output in text editor for @Inheritance

fields.description:
Hello,

BB Pipelines is a great tool for CI automation.\\
However, when things go wrong it is a nightmare to debug, specially when the problem only exist on pipelines and it is impossible to reproduce locally.

Most build tools generate logs with detailed information about what they do and errors or problems they encounter. NPM for example, when something fails gives you the following message (copied from a failed pipeline)

{code}
npm ERR! A complete log of this run can be found in:
npm ERR!     /root/.npm/_logs/2018-10-09T07_52_02_345Z-debug.log
{code}

It will be extremely valuable to read those logs and see the actual source of the problem with great detail.

I understand that supporting all the build tools on the market is an impossible task, so maybe you could accept this information on {{bitbucket-pipelines.yml}} file.

Thanks and regards.
fields.summary: [pipelines] Expose logs generated by build tools and other stuff

fields.description: We're trying to implement SDLC processes and would like to enforce PR merge controls. How to auto-add approvers based on source>target branch pull request?
fields.summary: Auto-add approvers based on source>target branch pull request

fields.description:
Hi

Bitbucket doesn't send the list of modified files via webhooks. Therefore it is not possible to add artifacts constraints in Spinnaker pipeline triggers.

Please refer following links related to the issue.

BCLOUD-11688\\
https://github.com/spinnaker/spinnaker/issues/2926

Thanks & Regards,

Thushara.
fields.summary: Bitbucket doesn't send the list of modified files via webhooks

Exact Match Search

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Fellow developer creates new branch and commits changes, makes PR.
# You open the PR in browser and start the review. While you review, fellow developer pushes some new commit(s) to branch/PR.
# The reviewer (you) has no way to see that the PR has changed and gives approval based ONLY on the initial commit.

BitBucket is happy to accept that and allows the fellow developer to merge, while actually NOBODY reviewed the subsequent commit.

Expected behavior:

BitBucket should reject the approval and notify the reviewer that he/she is approving an outdated version of the PR.

This behavior would be in line with another automatic behavior that BitBucket already has: automatically removing approval if new commits are added after PR is approved.
fields.summary: Approval ignores new commits to PR

fields.description:
I saw in some of my repositories that README.md's were rendered without formatting as below, while in others they were OK. I found one difference between them is whether the repository is private or not. Does it cause such a formatting problem?

!2649947216-%E3%82%B9%E3%82%B1%E3%83%83%E3%83%81.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Markdown rendering is failing in private repos?

fields.description:
We have 3+ pages of open branches at any given time and after a code release I make it a habit to go through and sync all branches with master to avoid them getting to far out of sync.  For those with conflicts, I will notify the owner and have them update manually.

Syncing all the branches one by one is tedious.  Would be awesome if there was a bulk sync functionality that would sync all branches without conflicts.  Any that have conflicts would be left untouched.
fields.summary: Sync all branches with Master

fields.description:
h2. Summary

After Issues Import, issue images (NOT attachments) are not visible to users who don't have access to the repo the Export was made from
h2. Steps to Reproduce
 # Log in to your Bitbucket account
 # Create a repo (A) and a private issue tracker
 # Create an issue in the Issue Tracker and add an image (NOT an attachment) using the button from the toolbar:  !Screen Shot 2019-09-13 at 14.17.43.png!
 # Save the issue
 # Export a zip with the Issues from the repo's Settings > ISSUES Import & Export

Afterwards:
 # Create a second Bitbucket or log in to a second Bitbucket account you may have (that doesn't have access to the repo above)
 # Create a repo (B) owned by this second Bitbucket account and a private issue tracker
 # Import the Issues zip you exported from the previous steps

h2. Expected Results

After importing the Issues zip and opening the issue, the image should be visible in the issue
h2. Actual Results

After importing the Issues zip and opening the issue, the image *is not* visible in the issue
h2. Workaround
 # Granting second Bitbucket account with access to repo A, will allow this account to view the image in the Issue Tracker of repo B
 # Otherwise, the images will need to be downloaded from issue tracker of repo A and then inserted in the issue of repo B
fields.summary: After Issues Import, images are not visible to users who don't have access to the repo the Export was made from

fields.description:
Hi,  all links to my the different groups are broken,\\
it forwards to weird link with a double slash.\\
*https://bitbucket.org/account/user//groups/developers/*\\
Now, I have to revoke some accesses, it blocks me from doing it.
fields.summary: Links are broken for all the user groups

fields.description:
There used to be an option to configure a branch or repo to prevent prevent history rewrite / force push. However, the UI has changed, and the option no longer seem to exist.

This is a critical safety feature, as without it, someone might accidentally destroy the entire history of the repo. Please bring this option back immediately.
fields.summary: Where did the option to prevent history rewrite go?

fields.description:
The new [branching model support |https://bitbucket.org/blog/introducing-bitbucket-branching-model-support%3Futm_source%3Dtwitter%26utm_medium%3Dsocial%26utm_campaign%3Dbranch_model]is a nice addition but it needs to be configured for each repository if I'm not mistaken (and it also has to be enabled for all existing repositories).

At least our team uses the same conventions in all repositories and I'd guess it's similar for most teams too. So it would be great not to have to configure the common branches for all repositories individually, but have team-level defaults. Then these can still be overridden in a given repository, but you wouldn't need to set them up for the potentially hundreds of repositories.
fields.summary: Branching model defaults for team

fields.description:
I recently found out that when I hit ctrl-f, I cannot use the browsers 'find' functionality on BB pages where code is displayed. It seems you implemented your own 'find' functionality.

Please look at the screenshot I attached. You have made a simple function unintuitive, and less powerful than it previously was. You have added nothing and taken away functionality.

I don't want to use your finder when browsers perfected this function years ago. Please remove this atrocious feature.
fields.summary: Custom search box doesn't allow browser search to be used

fields.description: It would be good to have an official SDK package for Bitbucket Cloud to make it available for customer's raising new projects.
fields.summary: Official SDK Package for Bitbucket - Created on customer's behalf

fields.description:
When I get an email that someone added me as a reviewer on a pull request, I open the link and I'm in BitBucket. But there's not a good way to look at the JIRA ticket that is being referenced by the Pull Request unless I go and search for it in our JIRA board.

There should be a link on the Pull Request that allows you to link to the task in the JIRA board, especially because JIRA makes a link for the PR on their end.
fields.summary: JIRA Task links to Bitbucket Pull Request, but not vice versa

fields.description:
"notebook viewer" is the cloud marketplace iPython/Jupyter notebook integration.

I have a Markdown cell in my notebook with an image:

{{![folded](data/folded-vert.jpg)}}

However, when viewed online via the "Notebook viewer" I see a broken image link icon:

!4180240365-Screen%20Shot%202018-10-04%20at%2010.32.27.png|thumbnail!

Viewing the source, it seems we're trying to read the image from some notebook-viewer-specific CDN, but 404:

https://bbnbviewer.us-west-1.prod.public.atl-paas.net/data/folded-vert.jpg
fields.summary: "notebook viewer" markdown images

fields.description:
Dear Devs,

Currently, there's a bug with the team accounts. In the past when users were trying to log in with an email address, we used to show the following picture:

!441238190-Team-login-disable-with-admin.png|thumbnail!

But currently, they only experience an infinite loop.

Is there any possibility to restore the picture shown above ^?

Thank you,

Norbert

fields.description:
Currently, when we create a new repository, we see the option to select clone method to HTTPS or SSH. However, the at the sample commands in the same page (Step 2) which shows how to add a remote, it would contain a SSH URL as a sample.

It would nice to have the URL to update according to the clone method selected. This is so that users wouldn't have to change the URL when they copy and paste the command.

!1088364727-Capture.PNG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Change remote URL in Step 2 on New Repository  when clone method is changed

Hello, I have a project, but I don't want to keep Pipelines build fail log.

Could you help to remove it?

fields.description:
I usually type bitbucket.org and then click on repositories to be able to search them.

It would be better if we could search immediately from the "your work" home page.

It is an unnecessary extra step for a common task.
fields.summary: Can you add repository search on home page when logged in?

fields.description:
When on the branches page for a repo, each branch shows a visual for how many commits behind and ahead it is from master. I'm consistently seeing that these lines don't pop out when changing page or switching between active and merged views at least two times.

Repro:\\
View branches\\
Click merged tab\\
Click back to active tab\\
Lines will not show and subsequent tab or page navigations will not show the lines

also

View branches\\
Navigate to a different page within branches\\
Navigate to a different page again\\
Lines will not show and subsequent tab or page navigations will not show the lines

Small issue but requires refreshing the page to get the visual back.
fields.summary: Branch "behind" "ahead" animations stop working after two clicks

fields.description:
Per this article: https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/automatic-branch-merging-776639993.html#Automaticbranchmerging-ordering

There is a specific branch naming structure that a project must follow in order to take full advantage of automatic branch merging. It would be great if there was a feature that allowed for custom automatic branch merging structure, even just to allow users to upload a text file in a specific format to define their own hierarchy.

In already existing projects, it is hard to adopt the versioning number system that BitBucket is looking for if it wasn't already being used to begin with.
fields.summary: Custom automatic branch merging

fields.description:
When definining artifacts that can be shared across steps one can download the artifacts via the UI (https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/using-artifacts-in-steps-935389074.html).

It would be nice to have the ability to prevent this for situtations where build artifacts may contain sensitive information, e.g. production keys that were passed in via secured environment variables.
fields.summary: Ability to restrict manual download of Pipelines artifacts

fields.description:
Hello,

I have a problem modifying my repo, I can't do any operation because by mistake there was a large file in the root and was uploaded and now can't remove it or make any changes, just a pull, and this repo is 2 months old so I don't want to alter my new changes locally. Please help

remote: Resolving deltas: 100% (25/25), completed with 18 local objects.\\
remote: repository is in read only mode (over 2 GB size limit).\\
remote:\\
remote: Learn how to reduce your repository size: https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/xgMvEw.\\
To git@bitbucket.org:xxxxxxxxxxxxx/xxxxxxxxx.git\\
! [remote rejected] master -> master (pre-receive hook declined)\\
error: failed to push some refs to 'git@bitbucket.org:xxxxxxxx/xxxxxxxxx.git'
fields.summary: Can't push or delete files because of size limit

fields.description: In order to improve Bitbucket and allow all users to easily add IPs to the whitelist, we would like to request a feature to allow users to whitelist IPs using REST API or that allow these to be added in bulk, either uploading a JSON/CSV file or a list (eg. ip1.ip2,ip3).
fields.summary: Allow Whitelisting IPs using REST API

Best Regards,\\
Senthil Kumar NH

fields.description:
Currently, admin or the user has no way to find out why they are not receiving an activation email and has to reach out to support. So it'd be best if the customer can check and confirm why their email is bounced etc.

Also, it would be great to get a feedback in the frontend that the email address is blocked and provide a feature to unblock the email address.
fields.summary: Ability to check bounced activation email

fields.description: The pipeline jobs does not fire on any commit.
fields.summary: Pipeline Jobs is not fired on commit

fields.description:
We have about 76 pipelines in our bitbucket-pipelines.yml file, with more planned. Unfortunately when we try to run a custom pipeline for a branch we only see 50 of the pipelines, and some of our more important pipelines have now overflown from the view.

We tested with Safari and Chrome and got the same results.

Please add the ability to select more pipelines.
fields.summary: Run Pipeline for A Branch only shows 50 pipelines

fields.description:
I think this is a validation bug. If a pipeline has several steps before the branch-specific steps (that will always be run), and the first branch-specific step is manual, the following error is thrown:

The first step of your bitbucket-pipelines.yml cannot be manual. Please remove this trigger from your first step or consider using custom pipelines

Here's an example pipeline yml that fails validation:

{code}
image: node:10.8.0
pipelines:
  default:
  - step:
      name: Jest Tests
      script:
        - npm ci
        - npm run test:unit
  branches:
    master:
      - step:
          name: Deploy to prod
          deployment: production
          trigger: manual
          caches:
            - node
            - pip
          script: # Modify the commands below to build your repository.
            - git remote set-url origin "https://$GIT_USER:$GIT_PASSWORD@bitbucket.org/max-digital/dsr-ptp-ui.git"
            - git config user.email "$GIT_EMAIL"
            - git config user.name "$GIT_USER"
            - git config push.default simple
            - apt-get update
            - apt-get install -y python-dev python-pip ruby-compass
            - pip install awscli # need to get a more recent version of awscli for cloudfront invalidations
            - mkdir -p ~/.aws && printf "[profile $AWS_PROFILE_NAME]\naws_access_key_id=$AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID\naws_secret_access_key=$AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY\nregion=us-east-1" >  ~/.aws/config
            - pip install -r requirements.deploy.txt
            - npm ci
            - npm run build
            - python deploy.py --env prod --bucket $PROD_BUCKET --cloudfrontid $PROD_CLOUDFRONT_ID --profile $AWS_PROFILE_NAME
{code}
fields.summary: First step in pipeline cannot be manual

fields.description: I have a repository that disappeared these days. What could have happened?
fields.summary: Repository disappeared

fields.description:
When logged in as an admin, while using the API, it would be useful to be able to get a list with the users that have access to the repository when running the "/2.0/repositories/{username}/{repo_slug}" API call described here: https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Busername%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D

Since this information is already available in the UI, it's expected the list of users which have access to the repo to be shown
fields.summary: Include the users that have access to the repository in the response of /2.0/repositories/{username}/{repo_slug}

fields.description:
It would be nice to be able to have certain steps ignore artifacts if they don't need them. For example, if Step A produces artifacts that Step B then uses, and Step C doesn't care about them at all, it would be nice to be able to ignore downloading artifacts for that step.

The reason you would want to do this is to simply save on build time.

Thanks
fields.summary: Bitbucket Pipelines - Optionally Download Artifacts

fields.description:
I migrated all repositories from our self-hosted gitlab to bitbucket, and everything went smoothly except 2 of our repos where the import process hanged.\\
Now I have 2 repositories (psycholate/carpe and psycholate/graduace-old) which are corrupt and totally inaccessible.\\
I'd like to delete them in order to re-create them and do the import again (I will do remote add and push from y local copy this time instead of using the bitbucket import tool), but I can't get to their settings page in order to delete them.\\
Can you help?
fields.summary: Corrupted repositiories due to failed imports

!1960775775-Screen-1.jpg|thumbnail!\\
!159216329-Screen-2.jpg|thumbnail!
fields.summary: For BitBucket Cloud, enable to add description or tagging for restricted IP addresses in "Team Settings => Access Control => IP Whitelisting".

fields.description:
Hello,

Could anyone tell me if there is a bitbucket plugin that declines Pull Requests automatically if the source branch is commits behind the mastes?
fields.summary: PR decline when a branch is to commit behind the master

fields.description:
Hi,

In our bitbucket.com pipeline, we use the docker build command with a Dockerfile to create a docker image.\\
Within the Dockerfile, we have the command:\\
"RUN rm /etc/nginx/sites-enabled/default"

Since this command seems to be silently failing (we do not get an "cannot find file" error or something else, the docker build process tells us that the command is executed and continues normally), we also added a:

"ls -la /etc/nginx/sites-enabled"

and can see that indeed, the file is not deleted in our container.

We experience this behavior since at least 24 hours (maybe up to 4 days).\\
We did not changed the build scripts/images and when executed on a different machine (not in bitbucket pipeline), the build is also working.

br\\
Tobias
fields.summary: Docker "RUN rm " is not working in Pipeline

fields.description:
If you have a Pipelines build page open up (e.g. you opened your latest pushed commit's build), then it's displaying various information. At some point, the overall pipeline run will fail or succeed. When this happens, the only indicators are:

* If you put text in your pipelines yaml to say success
* A green bar with an image of a green check at the top left  or  a red bar with an alert icon.

The latter is not very accessible to people with color issue. I have invert colors turned on and with my curren vision issues, it's really hard to distinguish the icon from the bar of color ... which is now some other color.

Could the individual pipelines build pages clearly indicate with some kind of textual indicator of success or failure?  The Pipelines overview page does this with "Successful" and "Failed" text.
fields.summary: Pipelines uses only color to indicate success/failure on single run page

fields.description:
In some use cases, it's necessary to have more than 8GB available to build.\\
For example, if you are using node modules (which are huge) + a bunch of services, you are pretty much certain to hit a memory roadblock.

It would be great if it was possible to use a "size:3x" flag of sorts, which would allow increasing Pipelines' memory further than 8GB
fields.summary: Ability to increase Pipelines memory further than 8GB

fields.description:
I opened a pull request to add google ads conversion tags to a website. When I opened the pull request, my ad-blocker was continuously reloading the page because the javascript was being read off my pull request code. This has the potential to be extremely harmful.

Google code in pull request:

!1662374000-google%20tag.JPG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Google Ads code is causing ad-blockers to reload the page

fields.description:
I go into the repository, click the "Pipelines" section, but the "content panel" is blank.

Tried with Chrome, Firefox and IE. Cleared cache, cookies and everything. Synchronized timezones. I've tried from a colleague's account and he can access this section, having the same roles/permissions as me.

Apparently, the bug comes from file connect-host.js

!3477977359-1.PNG|thumbnail!

!522794852-2.PNG|thumbnail!

The contentPromise callback is expecting the returned data to be a JSON, however it is getting a HTML document indicating the addon Pipelines has failed:

!2872463104-3.PNG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Pipelines section is blank

fields.description:
When working on or managing several pull requests, the titles in the tab of any of the major browsers will be identical - just the organisation name.

The full title contains the PR title, but it's preceded by the path (Organisation -> Project -> "Pull Request BCLOUD-1234" -> PR Title), which makes the truncated title very unlikely to contain useful information.

If the PR title was the first thing in the page heading, the truncated view would be useful, and prevent a lot of searching for the correct tab.
fields.summary: Pull Request headers should begin with the PR Title

fields.description:
The <title> element provides contest for bookmarks and the back button. My preference would be highest specificity first

Page > Project > Bitbucket
fields.summary: Improve html page title to include more context

fields.description:
When watching a running pipeline job if there's a tab open it auto-scrolls to the base. The problem being that I'm trying to scroll up.

Auto scroll should only take effect if the scroll bar is at the bottom of the page.
fields.summary: Pipelines auto-scroll
